briefdescription.para: Aborts the program with SIGABRT (dumping core).
Wrapper for setenv().

detaileddescription.para: If the value is NULL, unsets the environment variable.
There is an unfixable memleak in that it is unsafe to free memory malloced for use with setenv. This is because we can not rely on internal implementation details of the underlying libc library.
This function is not thread-safe, because altering the environment in Unix is not thread-safe in general.

parameterdescription.para: value of environment variable, or NULL to unset

simplesect.para: TRUE on success, FALSE if not enough memory.

briefdescription.para: Wrapper for getenv().

simplesect.para: value of environment variable or NULL if unset

briefdescription.para: Wrapper for clearenv().
Split paths into a list of char strings.

parameterdescription.para: string concated to each path in dirs
contains a list of splitted pathes return TRUE is pathes could be splittes,FALSE in oom case

briefdescription.para: Appends an integer to a DBusString.

simplesect.para: FALSE if not enough memory or other failure.

briefdescription.para: Appends an unsigned integer to a DBusString.

simplesect.para: FALSE if not enough memory or other failure.

briefdescription.para: Parses an integer contained in a DBusString.

detaileddescription.para: Either return parameter may be NULL if you aren't interested in it. The integer is parsed and stored in value_return. Return parameters are not initialized if the function returns FALSE.

parameterdescription.para: the byte index of the start of the integer
return location of the integer value or NULL
return location of the end of the integer, or NULL

memberdef.argsstring: (const DBusString *str, int start, unsigned long *value_return, int *end_return)
memberdef.name: _dbus_string_parse_uint

briefdescription.para: Parses an unsigned integer contained in a DBusString.

detaileddescription.para: Either return parameter may be NULL if you aren't interested in it. The integer is parsed and stored in value_return. Return parameters are not initialized if the function returns FALSE.

parameterdescription.para: the byte index of the start of the integer
return location of the integer value or NULL
return location of the end of the integer, or NULL

briefdescription.para: Random numbers.
Fills n_bytes of the given buffer with random bytes.

parameterdescription.para: the number of bytes in buffer to write to

briefdescription.para: Generates the given number of random bytes, where the bytes are chosen from the alphanumeric ASCII subset.

parameterdescription.para: the number of random ASCII bytes to append to string

simplesect.para: TRUE on success, FALSE if no memory or other failure

briefdescription.para: Converts a UNIX errno, or Windows errno or WinSock error value into a DBusError name.

xrefdescription.para: should cover more errnos, specifically those from open().

briefdescription.para: Converts the current system errno value into a DBusError name.
Assign 0 to the global errno variable.
See if errno is ENOMEM.
See if errno is EINTR.
See if errno is EPIPE.
See if errno is ETOOMANYREFS.
Get error message from errno.
